available_quantity_in_plan.description: Number of units included in the base plan

package_size.description: Number of units included in each addon package

purchased_count.description: Number of addon units purchased beyond the plan's base allocation

acceleration.description: Web acceleration settings for performance optimization

cache_any.description: How long to cache any response (including error pages) in the CDN

cache_arg.description: Specific query string parameters to include in cache keys (& separated values.)

cache_args.description: Whether to include query string parameters in cache keys. When false, URLs with different query parameters share the same cache.

cache_browser.description: How long browsers should cache content

cache_by_device_type.description: Enable separate caching for different device types (mobile, desktop, tablet). When true, content is cached separately for each device type.

cache_bypass_on_cookie.description: Bypass cache when request contains cookies. Useful for personalized content that shouldn't be cached.

cache_cookie.description: Cookie variables to consider in cache (comma separated values)

cache_ignore_vary.description: Ignore Vary headers from origin server when caching. When true, CDN ignores Vary headers and caches based on other factors.

cache_max_age.description: How long to cache successful responses (200 status) in the CDN

change_host_header_for_cname_records.description: Custom Host header to send to origin server. Useful when using CNAME records.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the page rule was created. ISO 8601 format.

id.description: Unique identifier of the page rule. Auto-generated when creating new rules.

image_resize.description: Image resizing and optimization settings. Allows automatic resizing, format conversion, and quality optimization of images.

is_protected.description: Whether this page rule is protected from modification. System-generated rules are typically protected.

load_balancer.description: Load balancer cluster ID to use for this page rule. Routes traffic to specific server clusters.

origin_cache_control.description: Respect Cache-Control headers from origin server. When true, CDN follows origin's cache directives.

redirect.description: Redirect configuration for this page rule. Includes redirect type (301, 302, etc.) and destination URL.

req_custom_headers.description: Custom headers to add to requests sent to origin server. Array of key-value pairs. Example: [{'X-Custom-Header': 'value'}]

res_custom_headers.description: Custom headers to add to responses sent to clients. Array of key-value pairs. Example: [{'X-Custom-Header': 'value'}]

res_hide_headers.description: Headers to remove from responses before sending to clients. Array of header names. Example: ['Server', 'X-Powered-By']

rewrite_url.description: URL to rewrite requests to. Used for internal URL rewriting without changing the URL in browser. Note: Cannot be used with redirect or secure links. Example: '/old-path' becomes '/new-path'

seq.description: Sequence number determining the order of page rule evaluation. Lower numbers are evaluated first.

set_upstream_timeout.description: Custom timeout settings for requests to origin server. Includes connection and read timeout configurations.

slink_secret.description: Secret key for generating secure links. Advised to be at least 8 characters long.

action.description: Action to take when the URL pattern and source criteria match. 'passthrough' allows the request to proceed normally, 'protect' applies DDoS protection measures (e.g., 'protect')

description.description: Human-readable description of the DDoS protection rule for documentation and management purposes (e.g., 'Block PHP file access from suspicious IPs')
examples: Block PHP file access from suspicious IPs
Rate limit API endpoints from specific countries

is_enabled.description: Whether the DDoS protection rule is currently active and being enforced

sources.description: List of source IP addresses or CIDR blocks to apply this DDoS protection rule to. If empty, the rule applies to all sources. Each entry can be a single IP (192.168.1.1) or CIDR block (192.168.1.0/24).

items.description: IP address or CIDR block to apply this rule to. Leave empty to apply to all sources.

url_pattern.description:
URL pattern to match against incoming requests using glob syntax. 
- `?` matches any single character. 
- `*` matches any (possibly empty) sequence of characters. 
- `**` matches the current directory and arbitrary subdirectories. This sequence must form a single path component, so both `**a` and `b**` are invalid and will result in an error. A sequence of more than two consecutive `*` characters is also invalid. 
- `[...]` matches any character inside the brackets. Character sequences can also specify ranges of characters, as ordered by Unicode, so e.g. `[0-9]` specifies any character between 0 and 9 inclusive. An unclosed bracket is invalid. 
- `[!...]` is the negation of `[...]`, i.e. it matches any characters not in the brackets. 
- The metacharacters `?`, `*`, `[`, `] `can be matched by using brackets (e.g. `[?]`). When a `]` occurs immediately following `[` or `[!` then it is interpreted as being part of, rather then ending, the character set, so `]` and NOT `]` can be matched by `[]]` and `[!]]` respectively. The - character can be specified inside a character sequence pattern by placing it at the start or the end, e.g. `[abc-]`.

action.description: Action to take when the filter expression matches. 'allow' permits the request, 'deny' blocks it, 'bypass' skips certain security checks, 'challenge' presents a challenge to verify the request (e.g., 'deny')

filter_expr.description: Firewall filter expression using HTTP request parameters and operators. Basic syntax: '<parameter> <operator> <value>'. Use 'and'/'or' with parentheses for complex conditions. String values in single quotes, sets in curly braces.

id.description: Unique identifier for the firewall rule

is_enabled.description: Whether the firewall rule is currently active and being enforced

name.description: Human-readable name for the firewall rule (e.g., 'Block suspicious IPs')

note.description: Optional notes or comments about the firewall rule for documentation purposes (e.g., 'Block known malicious IP addresses')

action_details.description: Details of bypass or challenge actions

oneOf.description: Configuration for bypass action that allows requests to skip certain security checks

challenge.description: Bypass challenge verification for matching requests. When true, requests matching this rule will not be presented with challenge pages (captcha, JavaScript, etc.)

rlimit.description: Bypass rate limiting checks for matching requests. When true, requests matching this rule will not be subject to rate limiting restrictions

waf.description: Bypass Web Application Firewall (WAF) checks for matching requests. When true, requests matching this rule will not be processed by WAF security rules

oneOf.title: BypassAction

oneOf.description: Configuration for challenge action that presents verification challenges to suspicious requests

https_only.description: Whether to only present challenges over HTTPS connections. When true, HTTP requests will be redirected to HTTPS before presenting the challenge

mode.description: Challenge verification mode: 1 = Cookie-based challenge (lightweight), 2 = JavaScript challenge (interactive), 3 = CAPTCHA challenge (most secure but user-intensive) (e.g., 2)

ttl.description: Time-to-live in seconds for the challenge session. After successful completion, the client is exempt from challenges for this duration. Range: 10 seconds to 1 year (31536000 seconds) (e.g., 3600)
